title: Amir Khan left furious after YouTube prank makes him think he's lost £2million

Amir Khan was left furious at his wife after a YouTube prank made him think he lost £2million.

28-year-old Faryal Makhdoom placed hidden cameras in the kitchen of their home for a video on her YouTube channel.

In the video 'King' Khan and Faryal are seen to be discussing money, with the former world champion wanting to change 7 million US dollars to GBP before the pound gets stronger due to Brexit .

However, during the discussion his beloved wife said that she'd accidentally transferred £2m into Sam's, a friend in on the prank, account rather than the £20 she actually owed him.

(Image: Faryal Makhdoom /Youtube)

(Image: Faryal Makhdoom /Youtube)

Makhdoom added that he was no longer returning her calls to continue the back story.

Rage took over 32-year-old Khan, "What the f*** do you do all day?" he said in response.

"From £20 you were supposed to put in, to £2million?

(Image: Faryal Makhdoom /Youtube)

"How do we get him to send it back?

"Legally, that’s it. We can’t chase him back for that money.

"From £20 to £2million you dumb f***. What is wrong with you Faryal?

Amir's rant ended with: "What the f***’s wrong with your head?"

Video Loading Video Unavailable Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now

After stringing him along for almost 10 minutes, Faryal finally revealed that she was pulling his leg the whole time and that the he'd been caught on camera.

Khan was evidently embarrassed by the whole ordeal and with Faryal crying with laughter she quipped: "Do you really think I'd give away £2m!"

Khan took to Twitter to share the video with an the embarrassed monkey emoji with hands covering its face, making light of the situation.
description: The Bolton boxer was left angry after he was pranked by his wife in the kitchen of their own home
